summary: Refugees receive multiple background checks, taking up to two years.

checks.short: Refugees receive multiple background checks, taking up to two years.
checks.name: The New York Times

checks.short: This is false. The vetting of refugees is careful and takes about two years, including FBI screening, Department of Homeland Security interviews and extensive security and background checks.
checks.name: The Washington Post

title: Refugees Can't Be Vetted
